poem:
**Last Resort**  

He just wanted peace,  
but chaos crashed in,  
like echoes down corridors  
of silver-screen pasts.  
Terrorists, hostages,  
a lone man's resolve –  
behind Die Hard curtains  
where echoes all chime.  
So grit your teeth, Michael,  
in this off-brand duel,  
yippee ki-yay whispers,  
a dance with déjà vu.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Sounds a lot like Die Hard, right? Yippee ki-yay, knock-off merchants.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
